required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of CIN-107 in Patients With Uncontrolled Hypertension Receiving 1 Antihypertensive Agent
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Multiple Dose Strengths of CIN-107 as Compared to Placebo After 8 Weeks of Treatment in Patients With Uncontrolled Hypertension Receiving 1 Antihypertensive Agent

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 2, randomized, multicenter study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of multiple dose strengths of CIN-107 in the treatment of patients with uncontrolled hypertension who are currently taking 1 anti-hypertensive medication

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in mean seated systolic BP (SBP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in mean seated diastolic BP (DBP)
Change from baseline in 24-hour urine aldosterone and serum aldosterone
Percentage of patients achieving a mean seated SBP <130 mmHg

arm_group.description: Remain on background (single drug) hypersensitive regimen for 8 weeks. After 8 weeks, patient may be up-titrated to a higher dose of CIN-107 and/or may come off their background anti-hypertensive medication for 4 weeks depending on BP control

Remain on background (single drug) hypersensitive regimen for 8 weeks. After 8 weeks, patient may be up-titrated to a higher dose of CIN-107 and/or may come off their background anti-hypertensive medication for 4 weeks depending on BP control

Remain on background (single drug) hypersensitive regimen for 8 weeks. After 8 weeks, patient may be up-titrated to a higher dose of CIN-107 and/or may come off their background anti-hypertensive medication for 4 weeks depending on BP control

Remain on background (single drug) hypersensitive regimen for 8 weeks. After 8 weeks, patient may be up-titrated to a higher dose of CIN-107 and/or may come off their background anti-hypertensive medication for 4 weeks depending on BP control

intervention.description: CIN-107 tablets by mouth once daily
Placebo tablets by mouth once daily
